alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:23PM EDT until August 12 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN HARRISON...SOUTHWESTERN CARROLL AND CENTRAL TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES... At 423 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Dover, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Dennison, Strasburg, Sugarcreek, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, Midvale, Bowerston, Barnhill, Dellroy, Sherrodsville, Roswell, Parral, Leesville, Stillwater, Atwood Lake, Leesville Lake Park, and Tappan Lake. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
